Detailed Description

types and prototypes for "test_" Test framework for performance testing

Define Documentation

#define TEST_ALIGN_SIZE   TEST_CL_SIZE
 

maximum shift of the source/dest start points for alingment testing (+1)

#define TEST_APP_TABLE_MAX   5
 

The maximum number of tables to emit

#define TEST_BUFFER_MAX   2
 

The number of buffers in the test. Default is 2 for src and dst

#define TEST_BUFFER_REP_MAX   512
 

The greatest number of test sample to fit in a buffer

#define TEST_BUFFER_REP_MIN   8
 

The fewest number of test sample to fit in a buffer

#define TEST_CL_SIZE   32
 

The cacheline size

#define TEST_DST   1
 

The default index for the destination buffer

#define TEST_EXTRA_PREFETCH   3
 

sets the maximum number of extra cachlines prefetched, w.r.t. the last cl processed by a test_function. Three is default as this is the number of prefetch slots on a Geode LX processor

How far ahead do the test functions prefetch (in TEST_CL_SIZE)

#define TEST_IS_CAT (  t    ) 
 

Value:

( \
        ( ( ZSTR_CAT_ZSTR == t ) ||     \
          ( CUSTOM_CAT    == t ) ) ? 1 : 0 )
test if test type appends source to dest (i.e. length is additive)

#define TEST_IS_MEM (  t    ) 
 

Value:

( \
        ( ( MEM        == t ) ||        \
          ( MEM_TO_MEM == t ) ) ? 1 : 0 )
test if test type use memory (i.e. not strings)

#define TEST_IS_ONE_BUFFER (  t    ) 
 

Value:

( \
        ( ( MEM        == t ) ||        \
          ( ZSTR       == t ) ||        \
          ( CUSTOM_ONE == t ) ) ? 1 : 0 )
test if test type only uses one buffer

#define TEST_IS_ZSTR (  t    ) 
 

Value:

( \
        ( ( ZSTR          == t ) ||     \
          ( ZSTR_TO_ZSTR  == t ) ||     \
          ( ZSTR_CAT_ZSTR == t ) ) ? 1 : 0 )
test if test type uses null terminate strings

#define TEST_MAX_BUFFER_SIZE   1024*1024
 

the largest the test buffers can be. Should be << system memory.

#define TEST_MIN_BUFFER_SIZE   256*1024
 

the smallest the test buffers can be. Should be 4x at least 2x the cachesize

#define TEST_PAT_BAD   " !\"#$%&'()*+`-./"
 

The default data pattern for padding that should'nt be found

#define TEST_PAT_DST   "abcdefghijklmnop"
 

The default data pattern for destination buffers

#define TEST_PAT_PAD   "0123456789:;<=>?"
 

The default data pattern for padding that should be found

#define TEST_PAT_SRC   "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOP"
 

The default data pattern for source buffers

#define TEST_SRC   0
 

The default index for the source buffer

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* T_test_cb_fill)(struct T_test_buffer *, T_test_sample *, void *)
 

callback function type for sample fill functions

typedef void(* T_test_cb_samp)(struct T_test_buffer *, size_t, void *)
 

callback function type for wrap and count change functions

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum T_test_toc_type
 

what type of count is used in the toc's samples

enum T_test_type
 

The overall type of the test. Defines default behavior for the buffers.

Enumeration values:
MEM  one buffer memory operation
MEM_TO_MEM  two buffer memory operation dst is size of src
ZSTR  one buffer string operation
ZSTR_TO_ZSTR  two buffer string operation dst is size of src
ZSTR_CAT_ZSTR  two buffer string operation w/ lengths add
CUSTOM_ONE  non-std, one buffer, no default fill action
CUSTOM_MORE  non-std, >1 buffer, no default fill action
CUSTOM_CAT  non-std, >1 buffer, non-src buffers are 2x size, no default fill action

void test_buffer_count_change (  T_test_buffer *    b,
size_t    count,
void *    data
) 
 

Default action to take on a buffer "count change" event, can be overriden by setting T_test_buffer::f_count.

Sets the toc for the current count if it has changed. Also responsible * for initialization (as count change happens in timetest(). Override this function by defining T_test_buffer::f_count

Parameters:
b  the 'this' buffer to affect
count  the current count
data  arbitrary private for the count change (ignored)

T_test_buffer* test_buffer_create (  size_t    type,
T_test_app *    app,
size_t    scale,
size_t    extra_pad
) 
 

Create a single test buffer.

TODO: Needs a destructor

Parameters:
type  buffer type 0 for src, 1 for dst, > 1 other (treated as dst)
app  the application state
scale  the multiplier for count to compute buffer sample size
extra_pad  the fixed amount to add to each buffer size
Returns:
test buffer structure

void test_buffer_fill_from_toc (  T_test_buffer *    b ) 
 

Fill a buffer with based on the toc entries and the fill callback. Since both the _const and _rand toc initialization routines set all sample fields this can be used in either case.

Parameters:
b  the 'this' buffer to affect

T_test_sample* test_buffer_next (  T_test_buffer *    b,
size_t    count
) 
 

Get the next sample from the buffer, handling the count change and buffer wrap cases.

Parameters:
count  the current count (ignored for rand)
b  the buffer to get the next sample from
Returns:
pointer to the next sample in the the buffer

void test_buffer_toc_const (  T_test_buffer *    b,
size_t    count
) 
 

Fills a toc for a given count and account for cacheline and align effects.

Parameters:
b  the 'this' buffer to affect
count  the current constant for the toc

void test_buffer_toc_rand (  T_test_buffer *    b,
size_t    current_count
) 
 

Fills a toc for a given count and account for cacheline and align effects.

Parameters:
b  the 'this' buffer to affect
current_count  the current constant count from the innerloop (e.g loop_innerloop() )

void test_buffer_wrap (  T_test_buffer *    b,
size_t    count,
void *    data
) 
 

Default action to take on a buffer "wrap" event. Can be overridden by setting T_test_buffer::f_wrap.

Fills the toc with a new random distribution if app->rand. Note that if f_fill is NULL not actually fill anything. Override this function by defining T_test_buffer::f_wrap

Parameters:
b  the 'this' buffer to affect
count  the current count
data  arbitrary private for the wrap (ignored)

size_t test_compute_buffer_size (  size_t    min,
size_t    max
) 
 

computes the buffer size from the strides and limits

Parameters:
min  the minimum sample size
max  the maximum sample size
Returns:
the size of the buffer to create

size_t test_compute_cl_stride (  size_t    size,
size_t    align
) 
 

Compute a cacheline aligned stride given a size and an alignment.

Note: the role of TEST_MAX_PREFETCH, is to ensure that extra prefetches at the end of an optimized routine do not affect the results of the next sample or test.

Parameters:
size  the size of the sample
align  the the alignment off set the sample
Returns:
cacheline aligned stride.

char* test_compute_next_cl (  char *    addr ) 
 

computes the next cacheline aligned address. If address is cacheline aligned, it is returned unaltered

Parameters:
addr  address to align
Returns:
cacheline aligned address

void test_create_buffers (  T_test_app *    app,
size_t    scale,
size_t    extra
) 
 

Allocates the default set of buffers NOTE: init buffers computes and allocates the buffers and the TOC but doesn't fill them. It does look at the T_test_app settings and the test_type to initialize the count and wrap call backs.

Parameters:
app  the application state
scale  size multiplier the samples: samp_size = count * scale + extra
extra  additional bytes for each sample (see scale parameter)

T_test_app* test_init (  const char *    progname,
const char *    progversion,
T_test_type    type
) 
 

Initializes the app state structure and command line (opts table).

Parameters:
progname  name of this program (information only)
progversion  name of this program (for help and usage)
type  the cannonical form of the test

void test_pat_fill (  char *    buff,
size_t    n,
const char *    pat
) 
 

Fill a char buffer with a repeating pattern.

Parameters:
buff  char buffer of at least n bytes
n  number bytes to fill
pat  pattern to fill the buffer with (a NULL terminated string)
